data.title: Lottie Williams (Actress, Born 1866)
data.meta_description: Lottie Williams (actress, born 1866)  - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Lottie Williams (1866-1929) was an American actress, singer, and dancer who pioneered in African American musical theater. She frequently performed alongside her husband Bert Williams on Broadway and in vaudeville. Some of their most notable performances were in musicals by Will Marion Cook, Paul Laurence Dunbar, and Jesse A. Shipp such as In Dahomey (1903) and Abyssinia (1906). Williams retired from performing in 1908 but continued supporting her husband's career. She and Bert adopted three of her nieces after her sister's death. Lottie Williams passed away in 1929 in Harlem, New York.
